name: Clin T GIST Appendix
title: Clinical T
notes:
**Note 1:** Assign 88 for in situ cases (behavior code /2). TNM does not include an in situ category for GIST appendix tumors.

**Note 2:**  Ignore intraluminal extension to adjacent segment(s) of colon; code depth of invasion or extra-appendiceal spread as indicated.

**Note 3:** Tumor size must be known to assign a T value. You may use a physicianâs statement of the T category if this is the only information in the medical record. If no tumor size is available, assign TX.

**Note 4:** For the following descriptions, assign the appropriate T category based on the tumor size.

    Invasive tumor in polyp, NOS
    Tumor confined to muscular wall
    Tumor invades through submucosa and muscularis mucosae to involve mucosa

    Extension through wall, NOS
    Fat, NOS
    Invasion of/through serosa (mesothelium) (visceral peritoneum)
    Invasion of/through serosa with invasion of/through mucosa
    Invasion through muscularis propria or muscularis, NOS
    Non-peritonealized pericolic tissues invaded
    Perimuscular tissue invaded
    Subserosal tissue/(sub)serosal fat invaded
    Transmural, NOS
    Wall, NOS

    Extension to:
       Adjacent tissue(s), NOS
       Connective tissue
       Mesenteric fat
       Mesentery 
       Mesoappendix
       Pericolic fat
  
    Adherent to other organs or structures, NOS
       Abdominal
       Adrenal (suprarenal) gland
       Bladder
       Diaphragm
       Fallopian tube
       Fistula to skin
       Gallbladder
       Greater omentum
       Liver capsule
       Other segment(s) of colon via serosa
       Ovary
       Retroperitoneum (excluding fat)
       Small intestine
       Uterus

    Other contiguous extension including:    
        Kidney
        Liver
        Ureter

    Confined to appendix
    Localized, NOS
rows:
Clinical evaluation performed but unknown results or extension not stated
Clinical evaluation performed but results not documented in patient record
Size is part of the T definition and the size is not available but information states that the tumor is confined to the primary site
Tumor 2 cm or less in greatest dimension
Tumor more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm in greatest dimension
Tumor more than 5 cm but not more than 10 cm in greatest dimension
Tumor more than 10 cm in greatest dimension
In situ case but no pTis is defined by TNM

No clinical evaluation of primary tumor
Cancer first detected on surgical resection
Unknown if any clinical assessment performed
